abstract: The U.S. Court of Appeals ruled that the FCC overstepped its bounds in telling Comcast it could not regulate bandwidth use. So what if your Internet provider could charge you for what you use?
snippet: The U.S. Court of Appeals ruled that the FCC overstepped its bounds in telling Comcast it could not regulate bandwidth use. So what if your Internet provider could charge you for what you use?
lead_paragraph: The U.S. Court of Appeals ruled that the FCC overstepped its bounds in telling Comcast it could not regulate bandwidth use. So what if your Internet provider could charge you for what you use?

headline.main: Net Neutrality: Not Just a Nerd Issue

abstract: A video about how heavy video providers and downloaders may find Web providers placing limits or charging fees.
snippet: A video about how heavy video providers and downloaders may find Web providers placing limits or charging fees.
lead_paragraph: As Edward Wyatt wrote on Wednesday, a federal court ruled that the F.C.C. overstepped by telling Comcast it could not limit the amount of broadband available to certain heavy users.

headline.main: Court to FCC: Back Off on ‘Net Neutrality’
